$BTCTitle: Bitcoin: More Than Cycles, More Than Gold
Message:
More and more investors and governments are realizing what we already know: Bitcoin is network gold. It is becoming increasingly scarce, more embedded in the market, and forms the foundation of any serious crypto portfolio.
But that‚Äôs not all. Bitcoin is also a functional network. It enables direct, secure transactions, supports new applications, and serves as a backbone for broader crypto innovation. This combination of scarcity and network functionality gives Bitcoin a unique position in the world of digital assets.
Don‚Äôt get distracted by stories about four-year cycles, halvings, or so-called crypto winters. That ‚Äònoise‚Äô says nothing about Bitcoin‚Äôs real value. The core is simple: scarcity + adoption + network features = sustainable value.
For investors, this means focusing on the real fundamentals‚Äîthe network gold and its growing functionality‚Äîand ignoring short-term predictions about peaks and dips. Those who follow a long-term vision build a robust foundation and benefit from the increasing trust of institutional players and governments.
In short: focus on the fundamentals and the network, not the noise.

$BTCTitle: Is the Bitcoin Cycle Really Over? What Investors Should Know
Message:
The traditional four-year Bitcoin cycle ‚Äì peaks followed by a year-long ‚Äòcrypto winter‚Äô ‚Äì may now be behind us. Increasingly, institutional investors, such as banks and large asset managers, are entering the market. In addition, governments are taking a more active interest in digital currencies. This new dynamic could mean that Bitcoin and other major crypto assets behave fundamentally differently than in the past.
What does this mean for investors?
The old pattern of extreme peaks and crashes is no longer guaranteed.
Institutional participation can provide more long-term stability.
Investors should focus on fundamental value, adoption, and use cases, rather than just historical cycles.
In short: Bitcoin remains volatile, but the market is maturing. Investors today would do well to look beyond the past and develop a strategy suited to a market with increasing institutional influence.

Galaxy Digital‚Äôs top researcher believes $BTC   could reach $250,000 by 2027, driven by long-term adoption and market maturation. He notes that short-term price moves remain highly uncertain, with wide upside and downside scenarios.   Despite current market weakness, $BTC  is increasingly behaving like a mature financial asset and could eventually take on a role similar to gold as a hedge against monetary debasement.

Millions of New Cryptocurrencies Flood the Market in 2025 - What Actually Matters  Crypto issuance accelerated sharply in 2025. CoinMarketCap data shows the number of tracked digital assets surged to 28.6 million, up from fewer than 6 million at the start of the year. That means over 22 million new tokens were created in a single year - one of the most aggressive issuance cycles the market has ever seen.  This growth was driven less by demand and more by lower barriers to creation. Low-code deployment tools, automated token launches, and the rapid expansion of L1 and L2 infrastructure made launching a token almost frictionless. At peak periods, tens of thousands of new assets were created daily.  However, most of these tokens failed to gain lasting traction. The majority never achieved sustainable liquidity, meaningful trading volume, or long-term user adoption, often fading within weeks. As a result, the market has shifted from scarcity to oversaturation, fragmenting speculative capital across millions of assets.  In this environment, what matters most is not token creation, but market structure and liquidity quality. Investors increasingly focus on depth, execution, and survival rather than novelty. The key takeaway from 2025 is clear: creating a token is easy, sustaining relevance is not. HISTORY HAS NEVER BET AGAINST THIS BITCOIN SETUP üëÄ

If you zoom out to the yearly chart, one thing stands out immediately. Bitcoin has never closed two red years in a row. Not once. Even after brutal drawdowns and long periods where sentiment felt completely broken, the market eventually reset and moved higher.

That doesn‚Äôt mean price goes straight up or that volatility disappears. It never does. What it means is that when people lose interest, get bored, or start saying the cycle is over, Bitcoin is usually rebuilding under the surface.

Annual candles matter because they filter out the noise. They don‚Äôt react to headlines, intraday moves, or social media mood swings. They show whether supply is being absorbed or distributed over time.

Right now, this looks a lot more like a reset phase than the end of something. History isn‚Äôt a guarantee, but it has a pretty strong track record here.

That‚Äôs usually when the market surprises people again. üëÄ

Zhu Su's Risk Management Advice: Don't Get Blown Out in a Supercycle 

In a February 2021 UpOnly podcast interview, Three Arrows Capital co-founder Zhu Su emphasized the importance of risk management, warning investors not to get "blown out" during a supercycle. He further outlined a supercycle narrative using a "5x gold market cap" analogy, suggesting that if Bitcoin reached a valuation of $50 trillion or even $100 trillion, the price could hit $2.5 million per coin. He claimed that timing the market was unnecessary. Ironically, shortly after delivering this lesson on avoiding liquidation, 3AC collapsed, leaving behind approximately $3.5 billion in debt. Zhu Su subsequently faced imprisonment, making this event a defining case study on risk management from the last cycle.

Trading activity picked up following the decision, with spot buyers stepping in near support levels. Derivatives data shows funding rates remain balanced, indicating that the move is not driven by excessive leverage. Failure to break higher could keep BTC locked in consolidation through the short term.  For now, Bitcoin‚Äôs resilience in the face of tightening from the Bank of Japan points to underlying strength. Whether that strength is enough to carry price above 90,000 this weekend will depend on buyer commitment and the absence of renewed macro-driven selling pressure.
